definitions.definition: The state or characteristic of being just or fair.
The ideal of fairness, impartiality, etc., especially with regard to the punishment of wrongdoing.
Judgment and punishment of a party who has allegedly wronged another.
The civil power dealing with law.
A title given to judges of certain courts; capitalized as a title.
definitions.example: Mr. Justice Krever presides over the appellate court

definitions.definition: Correctness, conforming to reality or rules.
